Q: Find all matrices $A$ such that

$$ A^2 + 2A = \matrixstart 23 & -10 \\ 30 & -12 \matrixend $$

A: We begin writing $A$ as the diagonal matrix $P \Lambda P^{-1}$:

$$ (P \Lambda P^{-1})^2 + 2 (P \Lambda P^{-1}) = \matrixstart 23 & -10 \\ 30 & -12 \matrixend $$

Factoring,
$$ P \Lambda^2 P^{-1} + 2 P \Lambda P^{-1} = P (\Lambda^2 + 2 \Lambda) P^{-1}$$

Now we compute the diagonlization of the result matrix $\matrixstart 23 & -10 \\ 30 & -12 \matrixend$

We get
$$S \Lambda_s S^{-1} = \matrixstart 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 3 \matrixend \matrixstart 3 & 0 \\ 0 & 8 \matrixend \matrixstart -3 & 2 \\ 2 & -1 \matrixend$$

Thus
$$ P (\Lambda^2 + 2 \Lambda) P^{-1} = S \Lambda_s S^{-1}$$

Clearly, $P = S$, $P^{-1} = S^{-1}$, $(\Lambda^2 + 2 \Lambda) = \Lambda_s$

Breaking $\Lambda$ into $\matrixstart \lambda_1 & 0 \\ 0 & \lambda_2 \matrixend$, we have

$$\matrixstart \lambda_1^2 & 0 \\ 0 & \lambda_2^2 \matrixend + 2 \matrixstart \lambda_1 & 0 \\ 0 & \lambda_2 \matrixend = \matrixstart \lambda_1^2 + 2\lambda_1 & 0 \\ 0 & \lambda_2^2 + 2\lambda_2 \matrixend = \matrixstart 3 & 0 \\ 0 & 8 \matrixend$$

The two simulatenous equations are independent of each other and readily solved:

(1)
$$\lambda_1^2 + 2\lambda_1 = 3 \\
(\lambda_1 - 1)(\lambda_1 + 3) = 0 \\
\lambda_1 = 1,-3$$

(2)
$$\lambda_2^2 + 2\lambda_2 = 8 \\
(\lambda_2 - 2)(\lambda_2 + 4) = 0 \\
\lambda_2 = 2,-4$$

It is readily verifiable that $A = P \Lambda P^{-1}$ satisfies the equation, with
$\Lambda = \matrixstart \lambda_1 & 0 \\ 0 & \lambda_2 \matrixend \forall \lambda_1 = \{1,-3\}, \lambda_2 = \{2,-4\}$

That is, any combination of the $\lambda_1,\lambda_2$ solutions from (1) and (2) suffice
